2step_token_placeholder: Type your Two Step Verification token here (6 digits)
2stepauth_info: Two-step verification, often referred to as Two-factor authentication (2FA), is a security process in which the user provides two authentication factors to verify they are who they say they are, thus providing an additional layer of security. You sign in with something you know (your password) and something you have (a code generated by your phone).
smartphone: To use two-step verification you must have an specific app on your smartphone:
configure_date: Before you proceed, configure your smartphone to get date, time and time zone automatically. The Authenticator will not work without this automatic setting.
How_to_2: 1. Scan the code below on your app or enter the key manually;
How_to_3: 2. Type the 6-digit code generated by your app on Token box below;
Problem: Problem reading the code? Type this key on the app:
2StepEnterCode: Enter your 2-Step Authentication Token (6 digit code from Google Authenticator)
2StepEnableInfo: Problem read the code? Type this key on the app:
2StepEnableDetail:
• Scan the code below on your app or enter the key manually;
  • Type the 6-digit code generated by your app on Token box below;
  • Click on Enable 2-Step button.
2StepHelp: Enter the 2-step verification created by your authentication platform
2StepImportantDetail: To use two-step verification you must have an specific app on your smartphone such as Google Authenticator, click here for install; Before you proceed, configure your smartphone to get date, time and time zone automatically. If you won't do that, it's not gonna work.
